AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.title: Tribunal Temple member
AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] joined the Tribunal Temple at [PAWN_possessive] lowest point in life. Ever since then [PAWN_pronoun] has been a steadfast believer of the Tribunal, even after certain slanderous lies were spread about them.

AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.title: Tribunal Temple librarian
AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.baseDesc: Many thought that [PAWN_nameDef] was simply one of the librarians in charge of tending the Library of Vivec. While this was, at least partly, the case, [PAWN_nameDef] was also in charge of dealing with certain heretical tomes. No one knows where they went, but after [PAWN_nameDef] got [PAWN_possessive] hands on them, they'd never be seen again.

AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.title: Tribunal Temple pilgrim
AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef], like anyone who wished to join the Tribunal Temple, was sent on a pilgrimage of the Seven Graces, and would have to travel to several locations of importance to the Dunmer. [PAWN_nameDef] may have gotten slightly lost along the way, and decided to just keep wandering until [PAWN_pronoun] happened upon something.

AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.title: Tribunal Temple shrine tender
AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.baseDesc: As a higher ranking member of the Tribunal Temple, [PAWN_nameDef] was given the honour of tending to the sacred shrines, an honour [PAWN_pronoun] took very seriously. Anyone who dared track ash into these sacred locations would get a stern talking to, so [PAWN_nameDef] yelled at pretty much everyone.

AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.title: Tribunal Temple healer
AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.baseDesc: Many came to the Temples when seeking aid, many were in need of healing, and [PAWN_nameDef] would attempt to help them all. Some would require elixirs, some a bowl of warm soup, and others simply kind words. But sometimes, someone would arrive, and there was no helping them, and [PAWN_nameDef] would have to call the Ordinators.

AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.title: Tribunal Temple judge
AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.baseDesc: As a member of the Order of Inquisition, [PAWN_nameDef] was one of the many that decided the fate of those that defied the laws of the Temple. Any that committed acts of heresy would inevitably stand before [PAWN_nameDef], or one of [PAWN_possessive] peers.

AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.title: Temple witchhunter
AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was one of the witchunters employed by the Tribunal Temple. While [PAWN_pronoun] occasionally made those that practised the profane disappear, permanently, [PAWN_nameDef] mostly sought out heretical texts and shrines.

AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.title: Temple witchhunter
AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.baseDesc: Whenever the Temple caught wind of someone delving into the profane arts, they sent in the witchhunters, and [PAWN_nameDef] used to be one of them. [PAWN_pronoun] was part of a force tasked with clearing out Assemanu, some abandoned cave system near Hla Oad. The second the Ordinator fell, [PAWN_nameDef] fled.

AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.title: Buoyant Armiger warrior
AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was a member of the Buoyant Armigers, a militant order of the Tribunal Temple that answered directly to Lord Vivec. While many days were spent sitting around Ghostgate, occasionally [PAWN_nameDef] would be sent to deal with heretics.

AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.title: Buoyant Armiger archer
AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was a member of the Buoyant Armigers, a militant order of the Tribunal Temple that answered directly to Lord Vivec. Many days were spent sitting around Ghostgate, which was perfectly fine with [PAWN_nameDef], as it have [PAWN_objective] ample opportunity to practice with [PAWN_possessive] bow.

AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.title: Ordinator
AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was an Ordinator in service of the tribunal temple. [PAWN_pronoun] would spend most of the day patrolling Vivec, watching all the scum, and looking for any reason to lock them up.

AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.title: Baar Dau warden
AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was one of the few Ordinators 'privileged' with wandering the tunnels of Baar Dau, making sure no prisoners were stupid enough to attempt escape. While some may have considered it a privilege, to be stationed in such an important place, [PAWN_nameDef] actually found it somewhat boring. For what was there to do up there, other than beating up prisoners?

AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.title: palace guard
AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was once one a highly esteemed member of the Tribunal Temple, whose sole purpose was to guard Vivec's palace. A highly important job, as the Warrior Poet was not to be disturbed, not even by someone claiming to be the Incarnate.

AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.title: High Ordinator
AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was one of the elite Ordinators tasked with protecting the citizens of Mournhold. [PAWN_pronoun] nearly lost [PAWN_possessive] life during the chaos caused by Sotha Sil's attack on Mournhold. Not by a fabricant, but from some peasant with a pitchfork. [PAWN_nameDef] began contemplating life once the peasant had been dealt with, and decided Mournhold might not be for [PAWN_objective].

AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.title: Ordinator in Mourning
AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] was one of the Ordinators in Mourning, elite members of the Order of the Watch, tasked with protecting the sacred burial grounds of Necrom. Much of [PAWN_possessive] day was spent wandering around the catacombs, ensuring nothing went missing, and scolding anyone who dared to walk at a brisk pace.

AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.title: Hand of Almalexia
AlienRace.AlienBackstoryDef.baseDesc: [PAWN_nameDef] wasn't just an ordinary Ordinator, [PAWN_pronoun] was one of the Hands of Almalexia, one of the most feared warriors in Morrowind. [PAWN_pronoun] served Almalexia with unwavering loyalty, until the very end.
